intro: Crepis rhagadioloides, commonly known as the desert thistle, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its spiny, leafy stems and yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has adapted to harsh environments through its deep root system and waxy leaves that reduce water loss. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Crepis rhagadioloides plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
